title: James Buchanan
summary: James Buchanan Jr. (/bʌˈkænən/ buh-CAN-nən; April 23, 1791 – June 1, 1868) was an American lawyer and politician who served as the 15th president of the United States from 1857 to 1861. He previously served as secretary of state from 1845 to 1849 and represented Pennsylvania in both houses of the U.S. Congress. He was advocate for states' rights, in particular pertaining to the institution of slavery, and minimized the role of the federal government in the nation's final years before the Civil War.
